text: Hafez Abu Seada (; 1965 â€“ 26 November 2020) was an Egyptian politician and human rights activist. He was Chairman of the Egyptian Organization for Human rights. He was known for his campaigns against torture and police brutality in Egypt. Abu Seada was also member of the National Council for Human Rights. He was born in Cairo, Egypt. Abu Seada died in Cairo on November 26, 2020 from COVID-19 at the age of 55. ==References== Category:Egyptian politicians Category:1965 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Human rights activists Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in Cairo
title: Hafez Abu Seada
